text: Chien-Ming Wang (born March 31, 1980) is a Taiwanese Major League Baseball player. He played for the Cincinnati Reds, Washington Nationals, and New York Yankees as a pitcher. Before he played for the Nationals, Wang played for the Yankees. He got 19 wins in the year of 2006 and 2007 and became the first Asian to be the win champion. However, after his injury in 2008, he started to pitch horribly as he attained an era of 9.64 along with 1 win and 6 losses in the 2009 season. He then got injured again and the New York Yankees did not renew his contract after. He became a free agent. In 2010, the Washington Nationals signed Wang and helped him recover from his injuries. He did not attend any games in this season. Wang pitched his first game on July 29, 2011 and ended the season with 11 starts, recorded 4â€“3 with a 4.04 ERA. On March 15, 2012, Wang was once again injured. When he recovered, his starting position has been replaced by Ross Detwiler and he pitched as a relief pitcher and sometimes a starter pitcher. But he still did not do well this season. Category:1980 births Category:Living people Category:New York Yankees players Category:Taiwanese sportspeople Category:Washington Nationals players
title: Chien-Ming Wang
